item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-16-08:00

Application Deadline:

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Senior Manager, Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be supporting the Analytics CoE for Avion Rewards. You will identify and lead technical solutions to optimize current processes, through synergizing data sources, developing self-serve tools, and partnering with cross-functional data SMEs. 

What will you do?

  • Identify, plan and deploy opportunities to achieve higher operational efficiency, through improving data retrieval from different sources, automating existing manual processes, and developing self-serve tools for business partners

  • Lead the development and maintenance of business intelligence dashboards.

  • Apply analytical thought leadership to problem solving. Assess and diagnose information needs, design and define suitable analytical solutions to generate meaningful insights that address business problems

  • Run multiple projects, oversee prioritization, and ensure projects are aligned with strategic priorities.

  • Ongoing evaluation of appropriate partners, tools, methodologies, and analytical techniques to ensure that our measurement solutions are best practice.

  • Be the subject matter expert on Avion Rewards offers platform data.

  • Manage and balance multiple stakeholders’ needs with competing priorities.

  • Evaluate success of campaigns and financial health of merchant partnerships, combining insights across all Loyalty & Rewards, Cards and Banking products.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL.

  • Working experience in building dashboards in Tableau or PowerBi

  • Instinctive curiosity and strategic mindset to drill into the analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth and the technical ability to apply this knowledge to resolve complex business questions

  • Leadership skills with ability to lead, motivate, challenge, and influence cross functional teams to deliver superior results

  • Communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company and have a talent for making the numbers, measure and targets come alive

  • 5-7 years of related work experience.

  • Self-starter, with the ability to use data for decision making and proactively make relevant recommendations to the business

  • Technical expertise with data modelling that supports BI tools.

Nice to have:

  • Previous work experience in a dual sided marketplace (B2B & B2C), retail or loyalty landscape.

  • Working experience with modern data architectures (Hadoop, Spark) &  cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure)

  • Proficiency with Python / PySpark.

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Client Data Analytics is part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provides monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of client onboarding and refresh activities. The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

What will you do?

  • Support the delivery of business analytics

  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.

  • Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership,
    frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.

  • Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).

  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored

  • Ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.

  • Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.

  • Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.

  • Support ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks
    from different sources of information across business units.

  • Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree

  • 2 - 3+ years of Capital Markets experience

  • Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation

  • Strong database experience and GUI development experience

  • Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau

  • MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint

  • Superior verbal & written communication skills

  • Superior analytical & problem solving skills

  • Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment

  • Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks

  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration

Nice-to-haves

  • Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.

  • Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking

  • Creative thought process and ability to innovate

  • Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and execution of fraud detection strategies using advanced analytical methodologies and techniques. These fraud detection strategies will be applied with the goal of reducing RBC’s Fraud Risk and losses, while maintaining a positive client experience and controlling operating costs. You will innovate and implement novel methodologies to improve detection and efficiency across the team, further automating and streamlining processes.  You will contribute to and support a variety of projects and initiatives across Fraud Management and collaborate with multiple stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

Please Note: This position is hiring across Canada

What will you do?

  • Implement advanced analytical methodologies and proactively identify opportunities to innovate new techniques for fraud detection strategy creation and process and technology improvements
  • Collaborate with Data Science & Innovation on machine learning and artificial intelligence projects that impact fraud detection, document methodology and standardize process to ensure repeatability
  • Develop, maintain and optimize fraud detection strategies for non-traditional channels & products, and explore multiple data sources to proactively identify emerging fraud trends and patterns
  • Leverage reporting to monitor the performance of existing fraud detection strategies, optimize these strategies and use analytical tools to improve detection strategies, enhancing the tools & techniques
  • Prioritize fraud detection alerts across detection platforms, verify that all rule deployments are accurate and ensure a balance between fraud losses, client experience and operational costs
  • Contribute to Fraud Management projects and initiatives, provide detection recommendations and  implement detection strategies by project deadlines
  • Develop Fraud Detection analytics best practices, contribute to the development and implementation of the rule strategy framework and create programming code standards for fraud detection
  • Collaborate across the team to ensure best practices are applied, act as a technical resource for other team members and respond to inquiries regarding fraud data and detection strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years’ experience in analytics or data science related roles, working with large, real-world datasets
  • Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and various programming languages (eg: SAS, R, SQL, Python etc.)
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and develop data-driven solutions
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Thought leadership capability to lead complex initiatives and discussions driven by analytical and business insights
  • Ability to see the big picture and guide groups with strategic thinking
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize workload effectively
  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
  • Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry payments transaction data and financial fraud 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Continued career advancement opportunities
  • Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

item.title: Sr. Manager Product Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Product Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?​

As the Senior Manager, Product Analytics, you will be responsible for supporting the analytics and data needs of the Personal Lending Product team. This includes providing actionable insights, data-driven product strategy, and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing strategies and financial models
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics (SAS / SQL)
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.) Programming experience with R and/or Python
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity mode

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Manager, Insights & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Insights & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Manager, Insights & Analytics, you will be responsible for developing tests that provides visibility into the effectiveness of key controls across all LOBs within P&CB. You will also work on streamlining our processes and finding analytical & reporting solutions to enable effective communication of business and operational risk insights.  

Please Note: This role is a hybrid opportunity, for applicants within commuting distance to Toronto Downtown offices.

What will you do?

  • Analyze data to derive meaningful and actionable insights that enhance monitoring of key risks.
  • Produce reports and analysis to enable effective risk management across all LOBs within P&CB.
  • Present risk insights to Operational Risk Directors and senior leaders within Business Risk Monitoring & Solutions (BRMS).
  • Ensure a framework and governance structure is in place, to maintain key findings, reporting and access to data of file reviews for regulators
  • Partner with teammates to design meaningful risk-monitoring measures for decision making.
  • Provide streamlining solutions for end-to-end operational risk reporting and key control test development.
  • Develop complex Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) queries to test key risk controls against a business requirements.
  • Coordinate quality assurance and back testing to determine if the rules are working properly
  • Support verifying data consistency between final reports, source systems, and data input; and assist with researching and enhancing automation methodologies
  • Be a member of the data accuracy committee, where issues are identified, recommendations are discussed, challenged and implemented

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years experience in reporting or analytics and a Degree in a quantitative field
  • Strong expertise in data querying tools and advance skills in SAS and SQL
  • Experienced in using Teradata to query EDW
  • Knowledge of data related to Retail and/or Commercial banking products
  • Proficiency in MS Excel (including Pivot Tables and data importing)
  • Strong presentation skills with the ability to communicate clearly and simplify complex concepts.
  • Solid communication skills, and ability to effectively converse with technical and non-technical contacts
  • Proven analytical and problem solving experience, with a collaborative attitude

Nice-to-have

  • Experience using DataMeer for ETL jobs
  • Experience building Tableau reports
  • Experience using Python for data analytics and/or automation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Competitive Compensation
  • A professional and supportive team environment
  • A comprehensive training program on internal processes and systems
  • Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. The Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies, including providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

item.title: Senior Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics

Job Description

RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence is hiring a Senior Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

What will you do?

  • Lead the design and development innovative reporting solutions to monitor operational performance, present insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing their business
  • Source data from various platforms and build automated data pipelines.
  • Lead conversations with business partners to solicit requirements and project feedback.
  • Apply standard design principles and advanced data visualization techniques to provide actionable insights.
  • Test and validate new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements.
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.
  • Frequently interact with internal partners to understand their business processes and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.
  • Lead design and solution review demonstrations with senior leaders and other internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications.
  • Be a thought leader within the Data & Analytics COE, applying a strategic lens to the development of automated insights, advancing technical capabilities and influencing an environment of continuous improvement.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau.
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Expert ETL and data modeling capabilities, and programming experience with large databases/datasets (using tools such as Python (Pandas/PySpark), SQL/SQL Server, Teradata SQL Assistant, etc.)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions.
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently.
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed.

Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Sr. Manager, CRM Strategy & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, CRM Strategy & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This role will be a member of the team supporting Marketing, Engagement, and CRM for Avion Rewards. Avion Rewards is a rapidly evolving program which requires the incumbent to be able to think fast, strategize in-depth, and proactively drive initiatives to conclusion with business partners.

What will you do

  • Provide proactive project management support to ensure cross enterprise marketing strategies are executed to plan and accurately measured post-campaign

  • Develop tests for various touch points in a client’s onboarding and post-acquisition life cycle, extract insights out of the tests, and deliver iterative improvements to our channels such as email, push notification, and in-app messaging

  • Work with enterprise and third-party partners to develop and maintain strategies, models, and processes associated with offer personalization.

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of our data collection capabilities, mature our monitoring and reporting stack, and recommend actions to ensure completion of business KPIs.

  • Optimize allocation of marketing spend to drive higher acquisition volumes and greater cost efficiency

  • Identify and streamline processes and mechanisms in order to reduce turn-around time, simplify work flows, and increase throughput

Must-haves:

  • Prior experience in business analytics, marketing strategy, acquisition strategy, or other quantitative strategy roles

  • Proven experience in designing marketing tests, analyzing results, and iteratively improving the business based on extracted insights

  • Strong technical skills in manipulating data via tools such as SAS, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop

  • Ability to communicate complex technical processes and insights in an audience friendly manner

  • Demonstrated effectiveness dealing with ambiguity and change

  • One RBC mentality, willingness take on whatever is required to elevate the business

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with advertising, engagement, and analytics toolsets such as Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Salesforce Market Cloud, Facebook Analytics

  • Budgeting and planning experience managing large scale marketing programs

  • Prior experience working in loyalty, rewards, or digital advertising businesses

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help all of our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

This role will be a member of the team supporting Marketing, Engagement, and CRM for Avion Rewards. Avion Rewards is a rapidly evolving program which requires the incumbent to be able to think fast, strategize in-depth, and proactively drive initiatives to conclusion with business partners.

item.title: Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics will monitor market risk and implement risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. This role will support the Director, E&S Risk – Climate Methodologies to undertake data analysis and explore the use of climate methodologies; work with others in the team to access and analyze climate relevant data internally and externally; visualize results of climate measurement work through dashboards and presentations; contribute to the cleaning and maintenance of data standards and the translation of climate measurement outputs into risk relevant data and business insights.

What will you do?

  • Play a key supporting role as part of the team that is working to meet RBC’s net zero by 2050 commitment and NZBA commitment to set interim reduction targets for high emitting sectors by conducting data analysis and working with climate methodologies
  • Undertake data analysis work that will contribute to RBC’s ability to stay aligned to its published climate commitments and work as part of a team to further develop E&S risk measurement capabilities and contribute to E&S risk integration and disclosure
  • As part of a team, work to develop RBC’s capabilities in transition and physical risk data analysis and collaborate with other RBC groups both within GRM globally and across the enterprise in respect of climate measurement for risk management and business strategy  
  • Support climate data work to meet regulatory requirements as these develop

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages (e.g. SQL, python)
  • Thorough understanding of data quality, application of data quality tests, and its impact on analytics
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights.
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives (e.g. PowerPoint, Tableau) and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Comfort working in an evolving fast-paced environment
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, highly collaborative.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Knowledge of ESG data landscape: common challenges and available solutions
  • Knowledge of controls and process documentation
  • Risk management experience particularly in relation to climate risk is a nice to have

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.
